newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: KL palm oil extends losses in line with soyoil.
newsitem.headline: KL palm oil extends losses in line with soyoil.

text.p: Malaysian palm oil prices fell further in early trading, extending Monday's losses after lower soyoil in Chicago triggered selling, traders said.
"The market is weak. There are more selling this morning and we expect this to continue as the July futures fell below the support level of 1,250 ringgit," a trader said.
At 0350 GMT, July futures contract eased five ringgit to 1,249 ringgit ($497.01) a tonne.
A technical analyst said the next support will be 1,235 ringgit. Poor fundamentals could also eased market sentiment.
